definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
abbr. for 柬埔寨[Jian3 pu3 zhai4], Cambodia
to follow admonition as natural flow (idiom); to accept criticism or correction (even from one's inferiors)
to remonstrate/to warn earnestly (esp. classical written Chinese)/to exhort
to counsel a superior in tears indicating absolute sincerity
to send or go on a punitive expedition
written admonition from an official to his sovereign (old)
(literary) to remonstrate with one's superior tactfully

sentences.english: To state outright and dare to remonstrate were his conduct of politics .
sentences.chinese: 直言敢谏是他从政品行的主要特点。

sentences.english: He pressed her to enter the competition.
Admonitionliang Bute dare say, by general recognition.
sentences.chinese: 良弼直言敢谏，深受将军赏识。

sentences.english: The control group admonishes must confess clearly.
sentences.chinese: 对照组的来谏也必须交代清楚。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, an adviser to the king happened to be passing by with his followers.
sentences.chinese: 其时，国王的一名谏臣碰巧和随从经过这里。

definition: to put forward a suggestion (to sb in a senior position)/to offer a word of advice
(of a court official) to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
official who dares speak frankly before the emperor
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
to remonstrate/to warn earnestly (esp. classical written Chinese)/to exhort
